channel.title: EasyRSC, making it public?
channel.description:
My question : I downloaded EasyRSC and coded it to my likes. (Npcs, drops...) Now it's done. I want to know how to put it public so anyone could log on it.
I heard that I need a Dedicated server, (or VPS? is better?).. I don't know anything about servers, dedi or vps. I also wanted to know that I searched over Moparscape and I found that EasyRSC wasn't related to a Forum because it doesn't need any registration to play it.
In short, what I need to put it online? Which forum should I use? Anything else I should know?
Thank you!

item.title: EasyRSC, making it public?
item.dc:creator: @C_R_O_O_K_S C R O O K S
item.description:
@C_R_O_O_K_S wrote:

Hey skee pee!
First of all you can find a free forum on google or use rscd www files, but you can delete the registrations to create in-game accounts and only use it as a simply forum for your easy rsc server…

VPS/DEDI: You can buy vps for 20$dollars and up to abit higher prices, but dedicated servers have better performance but they also cost alot more.
Its better if you ask a dedicated server company, the diffrence between dedicated server/VPS im pretty sure they know alot more about it.

put your server public: goto \Server\src\org\rscdaemon\server.java
search for: acceptor.bind(new InetSocketAddress("EDIT YOUR IP HERE", GameVars.portNumber), new RSCConnectionHandler(engine), config);
goto \Server\conf\server\conf.xml

<entry key="ip">EDIT YOUR IP HERE</entry>

Client: Edit settings.ini - server=YOUR IP HERE.

Hope you understand aLil;)
btw dont listen to the retards which has post this retarded posts in your thread… It seems like they dont know how to grow up.
and just play around with your rscd/easyrsc source and take your time, dont listen to these idiots.

Read full topic

item.title: EasyRSC, making it public?

@parkview wrote:

[quote=“Lukeidiot, post:4, topic:313661”]What your going to need do first is simply goto college for 8 years and learn java, then try to put your “server public”.[/quote] College for 2 - 3 years makes more sense buddy. 4 at the most.
